intro: Pasania trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded pasania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough or hairy texture. Pasania trachycarpa is often found in shrubland or fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained environments.
